## Houston ISD

* *Independent* defined
* Largest school district in Texas
* 321 sites, 273 schools, > 330 square miles
* [Geographically enormous](https://resources.finalsite.net/images/v1757703667/houstonisdorg/aq9uxdpyxkbs9ilajh2l/DistrictDivisionsSchoolsandAdministrativeFacilities20252026.pdf)
* \$2.1 billion annual budget: About 85% is payroll for 20,000 employees

## Context: New Leadership Governance

* Typically: School board (9) elected by the public. Board then hires/fires superintendent.
* Since June 2023, [this leadership change](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houston_Independent_School_District_takeover): No local control
  + State-appointed Board, Superintendent, Chief Academic Officer, Chief Finance Officer
  + Functionally a hostile takeover
* Stakeholder turnover & attrition since attrition:
  + Teacher turnover > 30% annually
  + Estimate at least 75% turnover by [principals](https://www.houstonchronicle.com/news/houston-texas/education/hisd/article/state-takeover-hisd-numbers-enrollment-principals-20199238.php)
